name: clansman
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person, especially a man, who is a member of a clan (= a group of families who originally came from the same family and have the same name): He appealed to his clansmen to stand up against the regime. Given that his surname is one of the most common in Scotland, he must have innumerable clansmen and clanswomen. Compare
clanswoman
More examplesFewer examplesHe was unflagging in his loyalty and service to his clansmen and the people of Scotland.The fighters were Somali clansmen.The rebel alliance is made up of the ex-leader's cousins, clansmen and former aides. Pashtuns in the province joined their clansmen in an insurgency.
